features.name: M.A.D.S.
features.officialDefinition: Decouples lateral control (steering) from longitudinal control (gas/brake), enabling the car to steer itself even when cruise control is disengaged.
features.userSummary: Steering stays on even if you brake or coast.
features.userTranslation: "Always-On Steering." The car steers for you even if you are in full control of the speed. You can coast, brake, or accelerate without the steering turning off.

features.name: NNLC
features.officialDefinition: Replaces the traditional PID/Indi controller with a neural network model that inputs past curvature to predict future steering paths. Directly outputs curvature for lateral control.
features.userSummary: AI-based steering. Smoother, but can 'ping-pong' on some cars.
features.userTranslation: "AI Steering." Instead of using math equations to stay in the lane, it uses an AI brain. It feels smoother and more "human," but if it starts ping-ponging (bouncing left/right), turn it off.

features.name: DEC
features.officialDefinition: Automatically toggles between Chill Mode (Standard Longitudinal) and Experimental Mode (Traffic Light/Stop Sign handling) based on driving context (e.g., speed, road type).
features.userSummary: Auto-switches driving modes. Note: Can cause late braking.
features.userTranslation: "City/Highway Switcher." Automatically switches modes based on context. Tradeoff: Can make testing specific models harder and may brake late for signs. Useful, but adds complexity.

features.name: ICBM
features.officialDefinition: A system designed to manage vehicle speed by electronically "pressing" the car's native cruise control buttons (RES+/SET-) to mimic full longitudinal control on cars that do not support it natively.
features.userSummary: Allows 'smart' speed control on unsupported cars by simulating button presses.
features.userTranslation: "Cruise Hacker." If your car doesn't support full self-driving gas/brake, this feature "spams" your steering wheel buttons to force the car to slow down for curves or speed limits.

features.name: SCC-V
features.officialDefinition: Uses the driving model's real-time vision (curvature prediction) to calculate safe cornering speeds. Automatically lowers the ACC set speed before entering a turn.
features.userSummary: Slows down for curves it 'sees' with the camera.
features.userTranslation: "Eyes-On Curve Slowdown." The car sees a sharp turn coming and slows down, just like you would.

features.name: SCC-M
features.officialDefinition: Uses OpenStreetMap (OSM) data to anticipate upcoming road curvature and lower the ACC set speed accordingly.
features.userSummary: Slows down for curves using map data.
features.userTranslation: "Map-Based Curve Slowdown." The car looks at the map, sees a curve ahead, and slows down before you can even see it.

features.name: SLA
features.officialDefinition: Automatically adjusts the vehicle's cruise set speed to match the current speed limit. Sourced from Map Data, Dashboard Camera (TSR), or a combination of both.
features.userTranslation: "Auto-Speeding." Automatically sets your cruise control to the speed limit (plus your custom offset, e.g., +5 mph).

features.name: ALC
features.officialDefinition: Initiates a lane change after a blinker input and a configurable delay timer, without requiring a torque "nudge" on the steering wheel. Can integrate with Blind Spot Monitoring (BSM) for safety.
features.userSummary: Click blinker -> Car moves over automatically.
features.userTranslation: "Hands-Free Lane Change." You click the blinker, the car checks the blind spot (if enabled), waits 1 second, and moves over automatically.

features.name: HKG Tuning
features.officialDefinition: Applies specific tuning profiles ("Stock" or "Dynamic") to the longitudinal control policy for Hyundai/Kia/Genesis (HKG) vehicles. Integrates with native Highway Driving Assist (HDA) status.
features.userTranslation: "Hyundai Gas Pedal Fix." If your Kia accelerates too slowly in "Eco" mode, switching this to "Dynamic" makes the gas pedal more responsive.

features.name: Custom ACC
features.officialDefinition: Allows configuration of the speed increment/decrement values for Short Press (e.g., ±1) and Long Press (e.g., ±5) of the cruise buttons.
features.userTranslation: "Button Remapper." Change your steering wheel buttons so one click changes speed by 5mph instead of 1mph.

glossary.ACC: Adaptive Cruise Control - Maintains set speed and follows traffic
glossary.ALC: Automatic Lane Centering - Keeps car centered in lane
glossary.BSM: Blind Spot Monitoring - Detects vehicles in blind spots
glossary.E2E: End-to-End - AI model that handles all driving decisions
glossary.HDA: Highway Driving Assist - Hyundai's native ADAS system
glossary.LDW: Lane Departure Warning - Alerts when leaving lane
glossary.TSR: Traffic Sign Recognition - Camera-based sign reading
glossary.WMI: World Model Iteration - Latest E2E model architecture
